heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 26 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (192°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 11.0m lower than yesterday, 269.5m higher than the past week, 116.5m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 789m minimum and 2540m maximum, with an average of 1460.3m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1190.7m and 1343.8m.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air moisture should feel ok and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and a mix of sun and clouds. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
